newsitem.title: UK: INSIGHT - Gilts to hold onto 111-02 support.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT - Gilts to hold onto 111-02 support.

text.p: June gilt futures on LIFFE will look to support at around one full point below current levels, technical analysts said on Friday.
"The gilt contract is holding onto 111-02 to 110-31," said a technical analyst at Merrill Lynch International in London.
"The key here is the spread against Bunds - Bunds have had a very strong downmove in the last couple of days in big volume, and the gilt/Bund spread is at a critical level," the analyst added.
June gilts were trading at 112-02 at 0718 GMT, 6/32 above Thursday's close.
Retracement support for June Bunds at 100.39 has knock-on implications for the gilt market, the Merrill Lynch analyst said.

"If we have a sustained move through the critical 150 level on the gilt/Bund spread, it will trigger a severe reaction to 142 and then to 125, in a retracement of the movement of the last three years," he added.
The 10-year gilt/Bund cash yield spread was at 150 basis points at 0727 GMT.
Resistance for the contract kicks in close to current market levels, at 112-09 and then at 112-20, the analyst said.
Richard Adcock, manager, technical research, at HSBC Futures in London, also sees June gilts able to rally short-term to 112-20, if they bounce off support at 111-26.
But "we feel further selling pressure can develop over the next few days, to take the market closer to the 111-00 region," he said in a note to clients.
September short sterling was at 93.17 at 0738 GMT, unchanged. Adcock put longer-term resistance at 93.28.
